definitions.definition: To encourage growth; to support progress or growth of something; to promote.
(comparative form of far) More distant; relatively distant.
definitions.example: He was standing at the further end of the corridor.
I have one further comment to make.

definitions.definition: (comparative form of far) To, at or over a greater distance in space, time or other extent.
definitions.example: I can run further than you.

definitions.definition: (comparative form of far) To a greater extent or degree.
definitions.example: Of the two civilisations, this one was further advanced.

definitions.definition: Beyond what is already stated or is already the case.
definitions.example: Chapter 10 further explains the ideas introduced in Chapter 9.
It is overlong, and further, it makes no sense.
Further to our recent telephone call, I am writing to clarify certain points raised.
